page.title: 12CHURCHES-ROMAN CATHOLIC
page.content: The Sawbridgeworth Roman Catholic Church used to be the Sawbridgeworth Cinema. It was purchased by the Diocese of Westminster in the early fifties. Previously, in November 1950, Mass had been said in a room at the White Lion (pub) or the Memorial Hall. A lot had to be done to make the Cinema into a Church. First, the roof had to be built again because it was too heavy for the walls. In September 1967 the Altar and Church were dedicated to Bishop Christopher Butler. The name of the Roman Catholic Church was Most Holy Redeemer. There was also a porch added on. The Roman Catholic Church has not yet got a graveyard.
